page.title: 02LOCH ETIVE,CONNEL
page.content: Loch Etive is 18 miles long and up to 1 mile wide in places.It is the least salty of all the sea lochs on the west coast of Scotland.This is because all the rain which falls on its huge catchment area drains out into Loch Etive by the Pass of Brander and Loch Awe. The tides in the loch have been recorded for 7 consecutive days by a portable tide gauge and it has been found that the tide range in the loch is only half of that outside it.The Falls of Lora is the best example of a sea waterfall in the world.Because of the narrow shallow entrance the water coming in at high tide cannot get out fast enough at low tide. On the north side of the loch,where it is narrowest,half way between its head and its mouth are the granite quarries of Bonawe.
